grails.plugin.multitenant.core.datasource
[Java] Class TenantJndiDataSource

java.lang.Object
  org.springframework.jndi.JndiAccessor
      org.springframework.jndi.JndiLocatorSupport
          org.springframework.jndi.JndiObjectLocator
              org.springframework.jndi.JndiObjectFactoryBean
                  TenantJndiDataSource

public class TenantJndiDataSource
extends org.springframework.jndi.JndiObjectFactoryBean

This class allows you to have a switching jndi datasource per tenant with the multi-tenant plugin

Field Summary
private CurrentTenant currentTenant

This is the tenant this data source is associated with.
private DataSourceUrlResolver dataSourceUrlResolver

This is the resolver to be used to determine the datasource.
private static org.apache.log4j.Logger log

This is a logger for logging status or errors
static boolean multiTenant

This allows the TenantBeanFactoryPostProcessor to assign a proxy to this object in spring since there is one of there for each client.

Method Detail

getJndiName

@Override
public java.lang.String getJndiName()
This method will look up the datasoure URL for the given tenant and return that url.
Returns:
The data source URL for the tenant via the resolver.

setCurrentTenant

public void setCurrentTenant(CurrentTenant inCurrentTenant)
Since this object is cached this allows you to resolve which tenant this resource applies to.
Parameters:
inCurrentTenant - The tenant id this data source is associated with.

setDataSourceUrlResolver

public void setDataSourceUrlResolver(DataSourceUrlResolver inDataSourceUrlResolver)
This will set the resolver type for this datasource object.
Parameters:
inDataSourceUrlResolver - The resolver to use to determine the datasource for the tenant. The types could be database or properties file.
